title: What's the most hilarious toxic thing you've seen either on your team or in /all chat BMs?
body:
Toxicity can ruin the gaming environment sometimes, but other times it's so absurd, creative, or over the top that it's just hilarious. 
Share your stories below so we can all get a laugh.

One game my adc said in /all “Report this Lulu for shielding me and stealing my cs.”

It turns out they thought Pix’s attacks counted as mine and, therefore, when I shielded the adc and Pix would attack with them, believed the last-hits were being credited to me. I ended the game with only 6 cs, by the way.

I'm autistic, with Aspergers- no joke right?

And I'm in a game of ARAM and some very uncouth individual calls my team something to the effect of:
 "autist. enemy team" 

Now, I feel like a lot of people are silly as heck when they use these phrases to describe stupidity- my team was doing fine in my opinion, a little tunnely but it was ARAM right?

Anyways towards the end when we were winning I /all'd
"HOW DOES IT FEEL TO HAVE AN AUTISTIC BEAT YOU!" 
And amazingly my teammate- someone I've never even met before said "Wait, you're autistic? Doesn't that make you half robot or something- that's not even fair to the enemy team."

Now keep in mind, that the Internet is just plagued with misnomers about autism. I was laughing so hard at this though, I've never had a compliment like that or even joke that wasn't really insulting aimed towards me much less autism in general. So what was toxic became banter, and than praise all in one game. Was pretty great. I feel like that falls under "absurd" a little bit, of all the people to get paired against and with I got that kind of interaction? Pretty fantastic in my opinion.
as another Autist, i feel you mate

I somewhat frequently get people who say things like "I am going to int" or "Kill yourself" etc. Just blatant, horrible things. Then they run it down mid and say "/all Dammit you're really good!" As if Riot only sees the /all chat and they won't be punished lol. 

The most aggravating thing is that if you say "/all report Poppy" or whoever it happens to be, the enemy will always take their side. "She's just lagging. I'm reporting you for harassing Poppy." Even though a second prior Poppy had literally said "I'm running it down mid because you didn't gank my lane."

You don't need to ask for reports. A single report does everything that nine reports do.

In fact, asking for reports is flagged as negative by the IFS, so it gets you closer to being punished.

Sorta. If your reports aren't valid, they don't count. But Riot won't tell you if your reports are valid or not. The more people that report someone the higher chance of that report sticking. 

Idk if this is true or not but I saw a lot of posts about it. If you report everybody every game your report holds no weight/credibility.

it used to be that way, but not anymore.

they have changed it.  every report works the same now
They took out report weights around 2 years ago.
Report weighting was removed when the IFS went live.

To be fair it's not a completely crap assumption because the support site *still* says that report weight is a thing. But small indie company, yknow? Updating HTML is a lot harder than reworking Ryze again.

I had an Ahri v Talon matchup.  I'd forgotten they changed Ahri's abilities, so I was already having a rough game and under leveled.

Talon would roam, I would ping and try to catch up on farm... and die anyway as soon as he came back because no one could stop him.

The same player both told me "play safe and farm" (which I was trying to do) and complained I wouldn't follow Talon when he roamed (which was pretty much the opposite of playing safe).
